constituent: shouldering, finger, fingers, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor
heisigStory: The key word of this frame refers to shouldering a burden of some sort. Its elements are: fingers . . . nightbreak.
koohiiStory1: One of Hercules´ labors was to hold the world in his fingers for Atlas and not move until nightbreak, shouldering the considerable burden.
koohiiStory2: One of the classic stories of shouldering a heavy burden is that of the kid who had to stick his finger on a dam until nightbreak to prevent it from breaking down.
myStory: vác. tay vác lên vai khi nghỉ đêm
readingExamples: 担ぐ (かつ.ぐ), 担う (にな.う)
words: to carry on shoulder, to bear (burden), to shoulder (gun)
